chapter.title: Upgrading
chapter.para: This chapter briefly describes the upgrade process for OpenAM policy agents.

procedure.title: To Upgrade Version 3 Agents
procedure.para: Follow these steps to upgrade a version 3 policy agent to a more recent version 3 release.

step.para: Backup the file system directory where the existing agent is installed.
In other words when upgrading a web policy agent, backup the web_agents/ directory. For Java EE policy agents, back up the j2ee_agents/ directory.
Extract the .zip for the new release over the existing agent files, replacing the current version with the new version.
When upgrading a Java EE agent, replace the deployed agent application with the new version.
Restart the web server, web container, or policy agent.

At this point, new configuration parameters introduced since the release of the earlier policy agent have not yet been set, and so the policy agent uses the default values until you change the configuration.
Make sure your policy agent configuration does not set parameters not supported by the earlier version.
When reverting a Java EE agent, stop the agent and affected applications, and revert the agent to the earlier version.
Restore the file system directory for the agent with the earlier version you backed up.
Restart the web server, web container, or policy agent.
